description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Hue's Enchantment" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Hue's Enchantment

places.generalDescription: Thien Mu Pagoda, a renowned 7-story Buddhist temple constructed in 1601, is a prominent landmark in Hue city. Nestled along the Perfume River and surrounded by landscaped grounds, this ancient pagoda holds great spiritual significance and boasts an impressive architectural design. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rich historical narratives and explore the various structures within the pagoda.

sources.snippet: Built on a small hill overlooking the Song Huong (Perfume River), 4km southwest of the Citadel, this seven-storey pagoda is an icon of Vietnam and as‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Must-see attractions Hue, South-Central Vietnam

sources.snippet: Learn about the history and stories surrounding Thien Mu Pagoda, and explore the structures inside the pagoda. Thien Mu Pagoda is widely recognized as the most prominent temple in Hue city, earning the prestigious title of the "Foremost Ancient Pagoda" in this former imperial region due to its ancient architectural grandeur, spiritual significance, and rich tapestry of enigmatic historical narratives. Situated merely 5 kilometers away from Hue's city center, accessing Thien Mu Pagoda is hassle-free through various transportation modes like cyclos, taxis, or scooter rentals.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda (namely Heaven Fairy Lady Pagoda), also known as Linh Mu Pagoda, is one of the most fascinating and ancient pagoda in Hue city. It is situated on Ha Khe hill, on the north bank of the Perfume River, in Huong Long village, 5 kilometers from Hue city, which is easy to reach from the city center. Thanks to such a mysterious history, the pagoda has attracted a great number of tourists from both inside and outside of the nation to come and explore the legend themselves.
sources.shortName: Top 16 Best Things to Do in Hue, Vietnam: Famous Attractions to See

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda, literally known as the Pagoda of the Celestial Lady, is a very famous monument that stands in the background of Hue City and represents the imperialism of the ancient capital city. This seven-story pagoda is one of the top attractions in Hue and a superb example of traditional Vietnamese architecture. Following the paths along the pagoda grounds, you will find beautiful bonsai gardens, praying halls, meditation halls, and towers for storing historic items.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places Of Interest In Hue For Your Best Vietnam Tour, Vietnam Travel Articles & News

sources.snippet: Perched along the bank of the Perfume River, the Thien Mu Pagoda is a timeless symbol of Mahayana Buddhism and cultural heritage in Hue. Dating back to the 17th century, it is most recognizable for its seven-tiered Phuoc Duyen tower, the tallest stupa in Vietnam. The Pagoda‚Äôs striking architecture against the backdrop of the lush Vietnamese hillside and fragrant lotus ponds have an undeniable allure that have even made the Pagoda a focal point of many local legends.
sources.shortName: Hue Vietnam Travel Guide: A Beautiful City Along Perfume River

sources.snippet: Located 4km southwest of Hue city center on the hill of Ha Khe, on the left bank of the Perfume River in Huong Long town, the pagoda is one of the finest and oldest architectural worship structures in Hue. The name of the pagoda comes from a legend that local farmers saw an old woman wearing a red dress and green pants on the hill. She said that a lord would build a pagoda in this location constructive to Buddhist configuration, and then she disappeared.
sources.shortName: Hue, a city of romantic beauty

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda, known for its stunning architecture and serene surroundings, is one of the most popular places to visit in Hue. This seven-story pagoda is not only a symbol of Hue‚Äôs cultural and spiritual legacy, it also offers a panoramic view of the city and Perfume River. In addition to its mesmerizing beauty, the pagoda also houses the iconic Austin car that the monk Thich Quang Duc used in his self-immolation protest in 1963.
sources.shortName: 13 must-visit destinations for first-time travelers

sources.snippet: Referring to Hue, we cannot ignore the scenic Thien Mu Pagoda, the temple with the most beautiful architecture in Hue. Although built in the 17th century, the pagoda has always been magnificently and magnificently renovated, attracting many tourists from near and far to visit. Coming to this quiet space, you can meditate quietly by the sound of the bells as well as enjoy the city scenery and watch the Perfume River flowing slowly.
sources.siteName: Vietnam.vn - N·ªÅn t·∫£ng qu·∫£ng b√° v·ªÅ Vi·ªát Nam
sources.shortName: 7 scenic spots in Hue you can't miss

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda, a spiritual tourist destination located on Ha Khe Hill, overlooking the Perfume River, creates an incredibly poetic and romantically rustic scenery. Everything here is gentle and peaceful. From a distance, you can see the towering Phuoc Duyen Tower, an iconic landmark that leaves a lasting impression on every visitor to Thien Mu Pagoda due to its ancient and moss-covered splendor.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Instagrammable Spots in Hue with Ancient Charm

sources.snippet: Established in 1601, Thien Mu is a national pagoda with more than four centuries of existence. Under the reign of Lord Nguyen Hoang, this hill area next to the Perfume River was considered the good land, so he decided to construct this pagoda here. The two main architectures of Thien Mu Pagoda are Phuoc Duyen Tower and Dai Hung Palace.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Places To Visit In Hue For Indian Tourists

sources.snippet: This oldest temple in Hue, dating back to more than 400 years. Situated above Ha Khe hill, on the north bank of the Perfume River, approximately 3 kilometers west of Hue Citadel, you‚Äôll find Thien Mu Pagoda, also called Linh Mu Pagoda or Heaven Fairy Lady Pagoda. It is one of the most magnificent temples in Hue.
sources.shortName: What to See and Do in Hue Vietnam

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda in Kim Long ward is also one of the most mentioned places to explore the city. This is a sacred destination for Buddhists from all over the world and circulates myths in many generations. From a distance, the pagoda appears as a giant tortoise carried on the back of an ancient tower.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Hue Tourist Attractions: Best Places To Visit 2025

sources.snippet: Hue is famous for having a lot of pagodas such as Thien Mu pagoda, Huyen Khong pagoda, Tu Dam pagoda and Thien Lam pagoda. These pagodas are designed with the unique architecture and the combination between old and new art, they bring visitors to the mystical spiritual world.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

sources.snippet: Situated on a hill overlooking the Perfume River, Thien Mu Pagoda is known as an iconic seven-story pagoda that stands as a symbol of Hue. From its elevated position, visitors are rewarded with panoramic views of the river, surrounding landscapes, and the city itself.
sources.shortName: 10+ Unusual Things to Do in Hue: Off-beat Experiences & Guide Updated 2024

sources.snippet: The Thien Mu Pagoda is a well known sacred and religious site in the city of Hue. As an important landmark in the city, this pagoda is still in use in the present day by Buddhists. One can reach here via a boat ride, which is an adventure in itself.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do In Hue

sources.snippet: Thien Mu Pagoda is one of the most well-known pagodas in Hue in particular and the entire country in general. This 400-year-old pagoda is located near Perfume River, making it an unmissable attraction for any Hue trip.
sources.shortName: A complete guide to the ancient capital of Vietnam
Things to do in Hue, Vietnam: 3D2N itinerary

places.name: Thi√™n M·ª• Pagoda

reviews.text: Beautiful pagoda right by the perfume river. Visited one late afternoon in August and it was very busy with tourists on tours. But the grounds are very peaceful if you keep walking back. Some monks were even playing badminton with public.

We visited the pagoda during the 5 day Reunification day labor day public holidays. Reached there by grab car. It was pretty hard to climb those steep stairs with overwhelming crowds.  Free entry. Beautiful garden, well maintained. The seven-storey pagoda is very photogenic. The view of Perfume (Huong) river is breathtaking. We walked back to the city enjoying the long beautiful riverside park path.

Thien Mu Pagoda isn't just a landmark in Hue - it's the iconic pagoda that feels like a serene gateway back in time. Perched on a hill overlooking the Perfume River, it's a place where history, spirituality, and stunning architecture all come together.

The star of the show is, of course, the seven-story pagoda itself. Standing tall and proud, it looks like a guardian watching over the city. As you walk through the entrance with its fierce guardian statues, you can't help but feel a little humbled - and maybe slightly judged for all your past sins (don't worry, they seem forgiving).

Inside the grounds, there's so much to see: intricate statues, the ancient bell that's as impressive as it is photogenic, and peaceful gardens perfect for a reflective stroll. The atmosphere is calm, even with visitors around, and it's easy to imagine what life must have been like centuries ago when this was a bustling center of worship.

Pro tip:
Wear comfortable shoes - the steps are historic (translation: uneven), and take a moment to just sit quietly and enjoy the breeze by the river. It's also a fantastic spot for photography, so bring your camera or phone fully charged.

Overall, Thien Mu Pagoda is a must-visit while in Hue. Whether you're there for the history, the architecture, or just a bit of soul-soothing calm, you'll leave feeling like you've gained a little perspective‚Ä¶ and probably a lot of great photos. üì∏

places.address: H∆∞∆°ng H√≤a, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Hue Historic Citadel, also known as the Imperial City of Hue, is a significant attraction in Vietnam and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It served as the royal palace for the Nguyen Dynasty for 140 years. The walled fortress spans 10 kilometers with impressive fortifications and features like the Imperial Enclosure and Forbidden Purple City. Visitors can explore attractions such as the ceremonial Thai Hoa Palace and Ngo Mon Gate within this historical complex.

sources.snippet: Start your first morning in the ancient capital with a visit to An Hien Garden House, one of the most beautiful garden houses in Hue. Imprinted the Vietnamese traditional architecture style, colored by untold historical stories, with a touch of Fengshui traits, An Hien Garden House is a graceful intersection of astounding culture and poetic landscape for visitors to indulge in. In modern days, two unique principles of An Hien are well-kept, the fascinating four-season garden and its originality in a Hue garden house.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Hue, Vietnam: 3D2N itinerary

sources.snippet: In addition, Hue citadel is a very great and wonderful place recognized the Cultural World heritage in 1993 by UNESCO that often attracts many visitors, especially on the occasion of Cultural Festival with the cooperation of French Republic held biennially. There are many cultural and artistic activities happening on these days. In addition, there are a lot of landscapes for visitors to visit in Hue including Ngu Binh mountain, Huong river, Bach Ma mountain and Hue garden house.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

sources.snippet: The former capital Hu·∫ø is one of the oldest cities in Vietnam, with ruins dating from the 4th century Kingdom of Lam Ap, still standing within the boundaries of the modern city. However, the most impressive and eye-catching architecture in the city dates from the final Vietnamese dynasty ‚Äì the Nguyen who ruled the country from Hu·∫ø between 1802 ‚Äì 1945. The crowning architectural achievement of this era is the Imperial City, often simply referred to as the Citadel.
sources.shortName: The Top 5 Best Places to Visit in Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Hue Imperial Citadel, a significant part of the Hue Citadel, is renowned as a major tourist attraction. It once served as both the residence of kings and a place for ancestor worship in the Nguyen dynasty. Centrally located in Hue City, visitors can easily access the Imperial City via Trang Tien or Phu Xuan Bridge from the southern Huong River bank.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: Located on the banks of the Perfume River, Hue Citadel belongs to the Complex of Hue Monuments, recognized as a World Cultural Heritage. This used to be the administrative and political center of the court as well as the living place of the king and royal family of the Nguyen Dynasty. A corner of Hue Citadel (Photo: Collectibles)
sources.siteName: Vietnam.vn - N·ªÅn t·∫£ng qu·∫£ng b√° v·ªÅ Vi·ªát Nam
sources.shortName: 7 scenic spots in Hue you can't miss
A complete guide to the ancient capital of Vietnam

places.name: Hue Historic Citadel

reviews.text: Inside, it showcases what royal life was like in the past. Although many buildings are under renovation, it doesn't affect the visiting experience. The place is spacious and great for taking photos - highly recommended for anyone to come and appreciate. However, there aren't many shaded areas, so it's best to bring sun protection and water.

Was really nice to be able to walk the walls of the citadel and the information panels along the way added all the relevant info. You could get an idea of how important the defences were in times gone by. Shame you couldn't get to upper levels in the towers. Take time to have a walk if you're in the area.

Beautiful location and truly special from a historic standpoint. Well worth a visit. Stunning location steeped in history for the emperor and family with great photos and art. A lovely location surrounded by moats and water but leaving a relaxed sense as you walk through the halls and grounds. Truly stunning and well worth visiting.

places.generalDescription: Ch√πa T·ª´ Hi·∫øu, an ancient Buddhist temple in Hue, is a serene and peaceful place surrounded by a pine forest. Built in the 1840s, it was once inhabited by eunuchs from the Citadel and now houses around 70 monks. The pagoda is known for its touching history and tranquil atmosphere that attracts many visitors seeking peace and meditation.

sources.snippet: Overlooking Dong Ba Canal, this pagoda was built under Emperor Thieu Tri‚Äôs rule (1841‚Äì47) and is celebrated for its four low towers, one on either side of‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Must-see attractions Hue, South-Central Vietnam

sources.snippet: Admire the architecture of Tu Hieu Pagoda, Visit the unique cemetery of Nguyen Dynasty's high-ranking mandarins. Tu Hieu Pagoda, located in Duong Xuan Hamlet amidst a vast pine forest, stands as one of Hue's oldest pagodas, constructed during the Nguyen Dynasty. Its architecture, influenced by the 19th-century feudal era, showcases intricately carved dragon and phoenix motifs on pillars and traditional tiled roofs, presenting a unique and impressive design.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: The name of this pagoda holds a significant meaning, which is piety. As its name suggests, Tu Hieu Pagoda places importance on an invaluable virtue in the people of Hue in particular and Vietnamese people in general.
sources.shortName: A complete guide to the ancient capital of Vietnam

sources.snippet: Why is the ‚ÄòTu Hieu Pagoda‚Äô one of the famous attractions in Hue?. Why is it a favorite spot for couples?. What is the famous love story of the national hero Tran Quoc Tuan and the beautiful Princess Thien Thanh?.
sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Hue ‚Äì Opatrip

places.name: Ch√πa T·ª´ Hi·∫øu

reviews.text: Went here when there was torrential rain however this probably added to the atmosphere. Really tranquil with beautiful trees and plants around. The temple and surroundings seem to be pretty open so you can walk around and explore as you please. We saw some monks praying while we visited which was nice to see. Probably one of my preferred temples visited during my stay in Vietnam.

The most serene pagoda with the sound of monks humming matras to lift their vibration. Both beautiful and serene with a bookshop across the road. I was also lucky to get a glimpse of young monk training for strength and martial arts. A truly special and unique experience.

Beyond its touching story of filial piety, Tu Hieu Pagoda is also special because of how its architecture blends so beautifully with the poetic scenery. It feels like you've stepped into a peaceful, almost magical world in the middle of a green pine forest. That's what makes this pagoda so unique: it's totally a part of nature.

As you follow the small, tree-lined path, Tu Hieu Pagoda slowly appears. It has this airy feel and a charming, simple look that also has a touch of Hue's royal architecture. When you get here, you'll feel so pure and will probably forget all your city worries while breathing in the fresh air.

places.address: CHP9+HVR, Duong Xuan Thuong III village, Th·ªßy Xu√¢n, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Mausoleum of Emperor Minh Mang is part of a serene lakeside temple complex that also includes the tombs of other 19th-century emperors. Each tomb reflects the personality and taste of its respective emperor, with statues and monuments arranged to form natural poetry. The mausoleum itself features traditional Eastern architecture inspired by Confucianism and is located at the confluence of Ta Trach and Huu Trac rivers into the Huong River.

sources.snippet: The Royal Theatre, begun in 1826 and later home to the National Conservatory of Music, has been rebuilt on its former foundations. When performances aren‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Must-see attractions Hue, South-Central Vietnam

sources.snippet: Built in the 19th century, Minh Mang Tomb is a large funerary complex surrounding the grave of Minh Mang, first Emperor of Vietnam‚Äôs Nguyen Dynasty. Although the tomb itself is completely sealed off to visitors underneath a lake, the entire complex is a must-see for its vibrant and symmetrical architecture that exudes a profound reverence for nature and Confucian ideals. I particularly loved stepping through all the bright red, yellow and green doorways here, that seemed to echo sentiments of love, royalty and nature, respectively.
sources.shortName: Hue Vietnam Travel Guide: A Beautiful City Along Perfume River

sources.snippet: These tombs are the four most famous of them: the sumptuous tomb of Gia Long (also called Thien Tho), the imposing Minh Mang tomb (also called Hieu Tomb), poetic Tu Duc Tomb (also called Khiem Tomb) and the magnificent tomb of Khai Dinh (also called Ung) whose names and arrangements reflect each point of view, personality and taste of each emperor. All toms were built during the reign of the respective kings. Each tomb was laid out with statues and monuments in perfect harmony to form a natural poetry.
sources.shortName: Hue, a city of romantic beauty

sources.snippet: Situated on the western bank of the Perfume River, approximately 12 km south of Hue City center, the Hieu Mausoleum, the tomb of Minh Mang, spans 28 hectares on Cam Khe mountain. Under the reign of Emperor Thieu Tri, the construction of this vast tomb was completed in 1983, having been started in 1840 by Minh Mang, the second Nguyen Emperor. Since Minh Mang adheres to Fen Shui strictly, he wants to create a symmetrical manner for his eternal rest.
sources.shortName: What to See and Do in Hue Vietnam

sources.snippet: Covered an area of 18 hectares, surrounded by a wall enclosing within 40 historical structures, including palaces, temples, and pavilions, doubtlessly, Minh Mang Tomb is considered to be the best combined natural landscapes and architectural complexes. The tomb is a reflection of military vigor and successful conquest, but also cultural conservatism. Minh Mang‚Äôs empire stretched across present-day Vietnam and into Cambodia and Laos.
sources.shortName: Explore the 3 most visited Emperor‚Äôs tombs in Hue

sources.snippet: One of the most majestic mausoleums in Nguyen Dynasty architecture is the Tomb of Minh Mang King. The royal tomb complex houses 40 constructions of palaces, shrines, pavilions, and towers under the influence of Confucian principles. From the central gate and 2 others on the left and right leading to the Honor Courtyard, you will encounter rows of mandarins, horses, and elephants‚Äô stone statues.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places Of Interest In Hue For Your Best Vietnam Tour, Vietnam Travel Articles & News

sources.snippet: This site is located on Cam Khe Mountain, Huong Tra town; thus, you can reach the tomb by renting a tour boat and enjoying Hue nature's beautiful scenery. The Tomb of Minh Mang King is one of the most imposing mausoleums in the architecture of the Nguyen Dynasty. All of his architectural works are built on Confucian ideas.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Hue Tourist Attractions: Best Places To Visit 2025

sources.snippet: Emperor Minh Mang's Tomb is renowned for its harmonious Feng Shui placement amidst nature's elements - mountains, rivers, and lakes. Its imperial architecture reflects the grandeur of the Nguyen Dynasty. Serving as a tribute to past generations, it's now a prime attraction in Hue, part of the city's historical ensemble.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: Besides it, there are several reputed and beautiful tombs as Khai Dinh tomb, Tu Duc tomb, Minh Mang tomb. These tombs are where the Kings are worshipped and recalled. While that, Khai Dinh tomb was recognized the Cultural World heritage by UNESCO, it is the grave of the King Khai Dinh-the 12th King of Nguyen dynasty.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

sources.snippet: Khai Dinh Tomb, officially known as the ·ª®ng Mausoleum, is situated in Chau Chu mountain, about 10km away from Hue city, Vietnam. The tomb is the smallest, but most costly and recent one in comparison with other tombs of Nguyen royals.
sources.shortName: Top 16 Best Things to Do in Hue, Vietnam: Famous Attractions to See

places.name: Tomb of Minh Mang

reviews.text: Its beautiful.The Tomb is covered with trees, lake and ancient buildings, which is very nice. You should pay for a tour guide. Our guide was a middle-aged man and he spoke so passionately and his knowledge of the place is amazing. One important note is that you should visit this tomb around 3 to 6 PM to avoid hot sun during the day. the sunset light is beautiful. Also noted that the whole place is open for visitors, but the tomb itself is forbidden. Only royal relatives can enter the tomb area once a year to pay tributes. Highly Recommended.

Rented a bike and drive here. Near a beautiful lake and surrounded by water. It makes for a nice walk around. We came mid afternoon on a super hot day so needed to grab some drinks at the entrance and again on the exit. There is toilets and drinks and some food options here. We came on a week day. You pay to park a scooter but they don't seem to charge locals but price is small. Not as big as we were led to believe but worth visiting.

A Serene and Majestic Heritage Landmark

The Minh M·∫°ng Tomb stands as a remarkable tribute to the splendor of the Nguy·ªÖn Dynasty. Nestled among verdant landscapes and tranquil lakes, it provides a serene escape from the pace of contemporary life. The architecture is both impressive and elegantly balanced, featuring intricately designed pavilions, temples, and bridges that harmonize with the natural setting. Impeccably preserved, the site invites visitors to enjoy peaceful walks along its scenic pathways. Rich in historical significance and visual beauty, it's an essential stop for anyone exploring Hu·∫ø. The courteous and well-informed staff further enrich the experience with valuable insights. A must-see for those with a passion for Vietnamese history and culture.

places.address: ·∫•p An B·∫±ng, ph∆∞·ªùng Long H·ªì, qu·∫≠n Ph√∫ Xu√¢n, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: C·∫ßu Tr∆∞·ªùng Ti·ªÅn, also known as Trang Tien Bridge, is a 402.60m long bridge spanning the Perfume River in Hue, Vietnam. It features six spans of comb-shaped steel beams and is designed in Gothic architecture. The bridge is a popular spot for locals and tourists to visit souvenir shops offering lacquerware, handicrafts, and unique Hue souvenirs.

sources.snippet: The Bridge with hundreds of years is the most typical symbol of Hue. Once coming there, visitors will learn about the impressive history of the Bridge in terms of both its existence and reconstruction as it has witnessed many ups and downs in the Vietnamese timeline. Truong Tien Hue Bridge has an ancient vibe, so it soon becomes an impressive background for people to take photos.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Hue Tourist Attractions: Best Places To Visit 2025

sources.snippet: The Truong Tien Bridge in Vietnam is a prominent bridge that marks an important sight and landmark that attracts numerous visitors all round the year. The bridge is a very nice place to observe, especially during the night time when it is lit up with electrifying lights. The prominence to the markets adds glamour to the attraction.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do In Hue

sources.snippet: When you step into the dreamy land of Hue, you surely can't miss the iconic Perfume River and the picturesque Trang Tien Bridge. The gentle Perfume River flows gracefully around the ancient land with its emerald green water, reflecting the shining sky, creating a truly poetic landscape in Hue. Check-in spot in Hue:
sources.shortName: Top 13 Instagrammable Spots in Hue with Ancient Charm

sources.snippet: Truong Tien Bridge, also known as Trang Tien, was built in 1899 and is linked to significant historical events in Vietnam. The bridge connects two banks of the Perfume River in central Hue. The north end of the bridge belongs to Dong Ba Ward, while the south end belongs to Phu Hoi Ward.
sources.shortName: Top 10 things to do in Hue: Vietnam‚Äôs former imperial capital
Discover a natural and romantic beauty in Hue

places.name: Truong Tien Bridge

reviews.text:
An absolute standout when the sun sets-Tr∆∞·ªùng Ti·ªÅn Bridge lights up in a stunning display of colors that reflect beautifully on the Perfume River. The ever-changing lights transition between vibrant green, purple, red, blue, yellow, and even a rainbow sequence, making it a photographer's dream at night.

The bridge itself is an iconic structure connecting the two sides of Hu·∫ø, with easy access for pedestrians. It's not a long walk, but it's one you'll want to take slowly to enjoy the views and atmosphere. The lighting setup is really well done-tasteful, modern, and enhances the whole riverside area.

Definitely worth visiting just before dusk so you can catch the transformation as the lights begin to glow. A great spot for an evening stroll, night photography, or just soaking in Hu·∫ø's riverside charm.

the bridge is narrow, nearly always crowded with cars and scooters and the pedestrian walkways are separated from the road by a fairly wide gap. There is some nice lighting that illuminates the bridge at night.
The iconic bridge in Hue is a stunning sight at night, with its vibrant colors changing every minute. It is truly a beautiful and mesmerizing sight to behold.

places.address: Ph√∫ Ho√†, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Mausoleum of Emperor Tu Duc is a stunning tomb and temple complex that pays tribute to the 19th-century ruler in a picturesque setting with a lily pond. Situated near the center of Hue city, this mausoleum is renowned for its harmonious structure and elegant architecture, standing out as one of the most beautiful mausoleums from the Nguyen Dynasty.

sources.snippet: The Royal Theatre, begun in 1826 and later home to the National Conservatory of Music, has been rebuilt on its former foundations. When performances aren‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Must-see attractions Hue, South-Central Vietnam

sources.snippet: These tombs are the four most famous of them: the sumptuous tomb of Gia Long (also called Thien Tho), the imposing Minh Mang tomb (also called Hieu Tomb), poetic Tu Duc Tomb (also called Khiem Tomb) and the magnificent tomb of Khai Dinh (also called Ung) whose names and arrangements reflect each point of view, personality and taste of each emperor. All toms were built during the reign of the respective kings. Each tomb was laid out with statues and monuments in perfect harmony to form a natural poetry.
sources.shortName: Hue, a city of romantic beauty

sources.snippet: Another location that draws plenty of people interested in learning about Vietnamese history is the mausoleum of Tu Duc King. Located in the village of Thuy Ba, this tomb complex boasts elegant architecture, a gorgeous landscape painted with a sense of harmony, and is not angular like other structures. As a result, Tu Duc King's tomb is regarded as the most beautiful among Hue's several intricate mausoleums.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places Of Interest In Hue For Your Best Vietnam Tour, Vietnam Travel Articles & News

sources.snippet: Built from 1864 to 1867, the Tomb of Tu Duc reflects the poetic soul of Emperor Tu Duc, the fourth emperor of the Nguyen Dynasty who was known for his love of literature and art. The complex encompasses romantic pavilions, peaceful temples, and a serene lake, offering visitors a glimpse into the emperor‚Äôs refined taste and contemplative spirit. Entry Costs: 150,000 VND/adult and 40,000 VND/child*
sources.shortName: Hue Vietnam Travel Guide: A Beautiful City Along Perfume River

sources.snippet: The mausoleum in Thuy Ba village is another site that attracts many tourists to experience Vietnamese history. Tu Duc tomb has sophisticated architecture, charming landscape painted with a harmonious space, and not angular beauty like others. Therefore, out of all the complex mausoleums in Hue's ancient capital, Tu Duc King's burial ground is considered the most beautiful work.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Hue Tourist Attractions: Best Places To Visit 2025

sources.snippet: Nestled in a serene valley near Duong Xuan Thuong village, Tu Duc Tomb graces the picturesque Vong Canh Hill. Despite the 143-year Nguyen Dynasty rule with 13 kings, only 7 royal tombs endure. Among them, Tu Duc Tomb proudly stands as one of the four most beautiful tombs in the former capital, recognized by UNESCO as a World Cultural Heritage site.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: Besides it, there are several reputed and beautiful tombs as Khai Dinh tomb, Tu Duc tomb, Minh Mang tomb. These tombs are where the Kings are worshipped and recalled. While that, Khai Dinh tomb was recognized the Cultural World heritage by UNESCO, it is the grave of the King Khai Dinh-the 12th King of Nguyen dynasty.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

sources.snippet: Emperor Tu Duc constructed the magnificent Tu Duc tomb as he had a deep love for poetry and the arts. It remains, to this day, the most majestic, imposing, and romantic of all the Vietnamese royal tombs. Tu Duc Tomb is an excellent choice for a day trip destination considering it is only 8 km from the city center.
sources.shortName: What to See and Do in Hue Vietnam

sources.snippet: The tomb of Tu Duc is Hue city is an important landmark that marks the history of another great Emperor of the city. The tomb is the final resting place of the great emperor who happened to be a great ruler as well as a scholar. The tomb had been erected before his actual death.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do In Hue

sources.snippet: Emperor T·ª± ƒê·ª©c had a strong affinity for art and poetry, a passion he channelled to craft his romantic, illustrious tomb. Tu Duc wanted his final resting place to blend harmoniously with nature. It is the greenest and most organic of all the tombs.
sources.shortName: Explore the 3 most visited Emperor‚Äôs tombs in Hue

sources.snippet: Khai Dinh Tomb, officially known as the ·ª®ng Mausoleum, is situated in Chau Chu mountain, about 10km away from Hue city, Vietnam. The tomb is the smallest, but most costly and recent one in comparison with other tombs of Nguyen royals.
sources.shortName: Top 16 Best Things to Do in Hue, Vietnam: Famous Attractions to See

places.name: Mausoleum of Emperor Tu Duc

reviews.text:
Amazing Tomb of Tu Duc!  This attraction was so wonderful, from the gorgeous grounds to wander around to the grand tombs and memorials, everything here seemed ready for an amazing photograph.  The memorials were grand with many steps up to impressive gates, towering columns, and the forests were so peaceful. There was grass under the trees despite the shade, which made it feel lush and relaxing.

The grounds were so enjoyable to wander around and so well kept, you can imagine what a fine place this was for an emperor, just beautiful. Highly recommended if you are in Hue.

This was by far my favorite mausoleum in Hue. It is set within stunning gardens filled with tall pine trees, peaceful ponds, and traditional Vietnamese architecture. It's a beautifully laid-out complex with lots of open space to walk around, relax, and take in the views.

The area is well maintained and shows great care in its restoration efforts. Everything from the stone paths to the wooden pavilions feels thoughtfully preserved. The large lake in the center reflects the buildings and trees beautifully, adding to the tranquil atmosphere.

We spent about 45 minutes here, but you could easily stay longer if you enjoy photography or just want to soak up the peaceful surroundings. It wasn't too crowded when we went, which made it even more enjoyable.

Highly recommend this one if you're visiting Hue-especially if you're only picking one or two mausoleums to explore. It combines natural beauty, history, and serenity all in one place.

Tuesday	     7‚ÄØam‚Äì5:30‚ÄØpm
Wednesday.    7‚ÄØam‚Äì5:30‚ÄØpm
Thursday	     7‚ÄØam‚Äì5:30‚ÄØpm

Monday	     7‚ÄØam‚Äì5:30‚ÄØpm

Stunning beyond my wildest expectations. I could have spent hours there other than for the heat. Without question the visit here has been my highlight of the whole trip to Hue. Early, early morning or very late afternoon most highly recommended.

places.address: C·∫ßu ƒê√¥ng Ba, th√¥n Th∆∞·ª£ng, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø 530000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Walking Street in Hue is a charming pedestrian street that offers a delightful experience for visitors. As the sun sets, the street comes alive with local vendors selling snacks and drinks, while providing stunning views of the Perfume River. This hidden gem is popular among locals who showcase their street arts and music. The short street allows for a leisurely stroll to take in the refreshing breeze from the river and explore wooden kiosks offering souvenirs and delectable street food.

sources.snippet: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Walking Street: Connecting Phu Xuan Bridge to Truong Tien Bridge, Nguyen Dinh Chieu Walking Street is located on the southern bank of Perfume River.
sources.shortName: Discover a natural and romantic beauty in Hue

places.name: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Walking Street

reviews.text: Loved walking along the boardwalk in the evening. It was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Hue. Beautiful views of the river and bridges, while watching how the locals enjoy the weekend. We also passed by a row of museums along the way and enjoyed the outdoor exhibits

Super fun to walk down, lots of restaurants and boba tea places to stop off at. Went during Tet 2025, absolutely manic and so busy. Saw the apartment cafe which is close to here as well as the Saigon Opera House.
Nice area to take boat ride see city views; park like setting along the river. Best time to go 20:00 most vendors are open and more people watching.

places.address: Nguy·ªÖn ƒê√¨nh Chi·ªÉu, Ph√∫ H·ªôi, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Hue Museum of Royal Antiquities, located in the former Long An Palace, is a long-standing museum showcasing over 10,000 objects including ceramics, textiles, coins, and royal costumes from the Nguyen dynasty. Visitors can explore a diverse collection that encompasses personal belongings and royal clothing of former Vietnam Emperors, furniture, Phap Lam enameled metal art, paintings and detailed murals. The exhibits are labeled in English with background details to provide insight into their historical significance.

sources.snippet: Established in 1923, the Hue Royal Antiquities Museum stands as the oldest museum in the former imperial capital. The Hue Imperial City Relics Preservation Center is housed in Long An Palace, a historic architectural gem dating back to 1845. This museum showcases invaluable collections reflecting the Nguyen dynasty's aristocracy and ruling class, displaying their material life, political ceremonies, and ideologies.
sources.shortName: 25 Must-Visit Attractions in Hue Vietnam for First-Timers

sources.snippet: The Imperial City is a part of of the Imperial Citadel back to the Nguyen dynasty. This used to be a combination of many temples, courts, pavillions, walls and gates, but unfortunately, mostly everything was destroyed during the Vietnam-America wars in the 19s.
sources.shortName: Top 16 Best Things to Do in Hue, Vietnam: Famous Attractions to See
Things to do in Hue: Local recommendations for you

places.name: Hue Museum of Royal Antiquities

reviews.text: A beautiful museum, the highlight is the throne of Emperor Duy Tan, he was just a child at the time so the throne was made for his size. Some items in this museum are only replicas. This area of Vietnam is a museum in itself, you have to spend a week or two here to visit all the emperors of the Nguyen Dynasty (1802 to 1945) and everything related to that period of time.

A place to store and deposit many historical artifacts, strong characteristics of Hue. Architecture, culture, fine arts, handicrafts... there are many things worth admiring. Come once to understand more about Hue

Great places to know about royal family, many great antique.
DM me if you want to know about good local food of Hue and accommodation.

places.address: 03 L√™ Tr·ª±c, Ph√∫ H·∫≠u, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Huyen Khong Son Thuong Pagoda is a serene and mystical Buddhist temple located in Hue, Vietnam. Unlike the popular tourist sites, this pagoda offers a peaceful retreat from the bustling city. Nestled amidst lush green mountains, it provides a tranquil environment for relaxation and spiritual contemplation. The unique architecture of the pagoda combines traditional and contemporary art, creating an enchanting atmosphere for visitors.

sources.snippet: Hue is famous for having a lot of pagodas such as Thien Mu pagoda, Huyen Khong pagoda, Tu Dam pagoda and Thien Lam pagoda. These pagodas are designed with the unique architecture and the combination between old and new art, they bring visitors to the mystical spiritual world.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

places.name: Huyen Khong Son Thuong Pagoda

reviews.text: Nestled deep within the mountainous region of Hue, this magnificent Buddhist temple is truly a hidden gem. Surrounded by breathtaking natural beauty, the temple stands as a revered sanctuary, reflecting the spiritual heritage of the area. Its impressive architecture and serene atmosphere invite visitors to explore and find peace. The tranquil setting, combined with the temple's grandeur, makes it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a deeper connection with the rich culture and spirituality of Hue.

Beautiful and peaceful. Free entrance. The toilet is very clean. Parking fee is 5,000 VND for scooters and 10,000 vnd for cars. At this time, there is major restoration/ upgrade work at the temple so may not be ideal to visit this time.

like some monks have found an infinite money glitch and are building themselves their little Instagram paradise palace, erm, pagoda. toilets at the entrance are the only thing left in their historical state-disgusting.

places.address: FF2V+FJX, Ch·∫ßm, Long H·ªì, H∆∞∆°ng Tr√†, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Tu Dam Pagoda is a serene Buddhist temple complex in Hue, founded in 1683 and later became a site of anti-government protests in the 1960s. Tucked away behind the main railway station, it offers a peaceful retreat with beautiful landscaped grounds and magnificent mahogany buildings adorned with silk lanterns. This pagoda is part of Hue's collection of unique architectural wonders that blend old and new art, providing visitors with a mystical spiritual experience.

sources.snippet: Hue is famous for having a lot of pagodas such as Thien Mu pagoda, Huyen Khong pagoda, Tu Dam pagoda and Thien Lam pagoda. These pagodas are designed with the unique architecture and the combination between old and new art, they bring visitors to the mystical spiritual world.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

sources.snippet: Tu Dam Pagoda finds the balance between tradition and modernity, perfectly blending two different styles of architecture. Visitors can combine visiting Tu Dam Pagoda with the nearby Minh Mang Tomb.
sources.shortName: A complete guide to the ancient capital of Vietnam

sources.snippet: Tu Dam Pagoda is a Buddhist temple dating back to the 17th century. According to legend, the temple was built by Zen master Minh Hai, who was famous for his teachings and spiritual guidance.
sources.shortName: Hue Vietnam Travel Guide: A Beautiful City Along Perfume River

places.name: Tu Dam Pagoda

reviews.text:
T·ª´ ƒê√†m Pagoda in Hu·∫ø is one of the most peaceful and spiritually significant places I've ever visited. Nestled in the heart of the ancient imperial city, this pagoda is not only a place of worship but also a cultural and historical landmark that reflects the deep roots of Vietnamese Buddhism.

What makes T·ª´ ƒê√†m Pagoda especially meaningful to me is the legacy of one of its most revered monks: Venerable Th√≠ch Tr√≠ Quang. I have long admired him for his intellect, his dedication to Buddhism, and especially his work translating and interpreting many important Buddhist texts into Vietnamese. His influence on Vietnamese Buddhism, both in spiritual and cultural terms, is profound. Though he has passed away, his spirit and teachings are very much alive in this sacred space. It was incredibly moving to walk through the grounds and know that this was a place he once walked, taught, and meditated.

The pagoda itself is beautiful - quiet, clean, and filled with the scent of incense. The architecture is traditional yet timeless, with a large main hall, well-tended gardens, and statues that inspire a deep sense of calm and reverence. The monks and caretakers are kind and respectful, and there is a genuine atmosphere of compassion and wisdom here.

If you are in Hu·∫ø and seeking a meaningful spiritual experience - or simply want a quiet space to reflect - I highly recommend visiting T·ª´ ƒê√†m Pagoda. For me, it was more than a visit; it was a moment of connection with history, faith, and the legacy of a great teacher.

Tu Dam Temple can be dated in the 17th century. However the Pagoda on the site looks pretty recent. It is a calm place with almost no tourists and worth a visit if you are in Hue.
There is an impressive tree on the site which is supposed to represent the Bodhi Tree under which Buddha was enlightened. That is what makes it special.
Beautiful and serene pagoda. No tourists and you will find monks praying. You can sit and relax and pray here and spend hours doing nothing. No ticket to enter.

places.address: 1 S∆∞ Li·ªÖu Qu√°n, Tr∆∞·ªùng An, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: B·∫£o T√†ng L·ªãch S·ª≠ C·∫ßu Ng√≥i Thanh To√†n, also known as Thanh Toan Bridge, is an 18th-century wooden footbridge with a tile roof located about seven kilometers outside of Hue. This Japanese-style bridge was built over a small river to provide locals with a means to cross without a boat and offer rural workers respite from the sun.

sources.snippet: A classic covered Japanese footbridge in picturesque countryside, this makes a lovely diversion from Hue. The bridge is in sleepy Thuy Thanh village, 7km‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Must-see attractions Hue, South-Central Vietnam

sources.snippet: Thanh Toan Bridge is located on the outskirts of Hue city, but there are many ways to reach it. The tiled Bridge over 200 years old in Hue possesses a unique beauty and presents as one of the very few remaining works built in the style of Japan in Vietnam. On special days like Hue Festival, the quiet tile bridge becomes dazzling by the fresh colors of lanterns, flowers, and fluttering flags, creating a vibrant accent for the idyllic countryside.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Hue Tourist Attractions: Best Places To Visit 2025

sources.snippet: Situated on the outskirts of Hue city, Thanh Toan Bridge is a special wooden tile-roofed footbridge dating back to the 18th century. The old bridge over 200 years old was built over a small river to connect the two villages as well as provide an escape from the heat for villagers. On special days like the Hue Festival, the Japanese-style bridge becomes very colorful with lanterns, flowers, and flags moving in the wind.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places Of Interest In Hue For Your Best Vietnam Tour, Vietnam Travel Articles & News

sources.snippet: The Thanh Toan Bridge in Hue city is a prominent place of attraction for the tourists who come to this city in exploration of its many historic landmarks and places. The bridge is an exemplary point to discover the historical construction of the era of the emperors. The Thanh Toan Bridge is also a perfect place to discover the beauty of the nature and the implicit little constructions along the bridge.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do In Hue

sources.snippet: Another historic site in Hue is Thanh Toan, a traditional tile roof bridge. Built in 1776, it was constructed by Mrs. Tran Thi Dao, a local to the area who wanted to improve transportation and communication in the village along both sides of the canal. The roof of the bridge is decorated in lapis lazuli, pearl inlays and dragon carvings.
sources.shortName: Hue Vietnam Travel Guide: A Beautiful City Along Perfume River

sources.snippet: One of Hue‚Äôs tourist attractions that makes you impressive at first sight is Thanh Toan Bridge. This 18-meter-long ancient wooden bridge with exquisite details has become a historical relic in Hue. It was built in 1776 with the money of a noblewoman who wished to help the villagers cross the river easily.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Places To Visit In Hue For Indian Tourists
Things to do in Hue: Local recommendations for you

places.name: Thanh Toan Bridge

reviews.text: Went early in the morning and there was no crowd. Nearby shops and local marketplace already opened with quiet bustle. Beautiful traditional old bridge built by a lady in the past to benefit the locals also as a refuge for poor. Nowadays used more as a community space by the old folks. Many coffee joints and eateries around. Free entry.

Worth a visit though probably best in Autumn. Check with your hotel about evening activities. Could have night food markets. I went mid morning and it was still lovely to visit. Very serene and stunning. Also worthwhile organising a driver to pick you up after. I was fortunate the same Grab driver returned but I think it may have been difficult otherwise. He recognised the call out.

This beautiful historic bridge dates back to 1776 and is incredibly well preserved. Its tile-roofed architecture and ornate dragon motifs make it a great example of traditional Vietnamese design. It's a peaceful spot to admire the craftsmanship and relax by the water.

That said, the surrounding village area felt quite deserted and underdeveloped. There are hints that it once had more tourist potential, but today it's very quiet and feels somewhat forgotten. Still, if you're looking to explore something different outside of Hue city, it's worth a short visit.

We walked the 4.5km from Hue, which made for a decent workout under the sun! While the walk is long and the attraction is relatively small, it's a pleasant side trip-especially if you enjoy historical architecture or scenic photography.

Tip: There are some lovely photo angles from across the canal and under the trees. If you're already in Hue and have time to spare, it's a nice detour.

places.address: FJ8R+MRX, Th·ªßy Ph∆∞∆°ng, H∆∞∆°ng Th·ªßy, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: PhinHolic, located in the heart of downtown Hue, is a beautiful cafe with an extensive menu featuring various types of coffee, tea, and fruit juices. The Phin Signature section of the menu is particularly noteworthy. The cafe offers ample seating space and excellent air conditioning. While some drinks like the cheese coffee received mixed reviews due to individual taste preferences, others like the cold brew were described as delicious.

sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Hue ‚Äì Opatrip

places.name: PhinHolic

reviews.text: I visit many cafes, but I occasionally see cafes where people try to put something in their coffee; things like the condition of the coffee beans, the degree of roasting, the temperature of the water and the condition of the foam, the quality of the milk and the way it is mixed, etc. When ordering a latte, I wonder what kind of thoughts they are going to put in today. I enjoy the richness and strong savory flavor of Robusta Coffee's espresso, and the softness of the milk and foam, and then the bitterness of the coffee again. After taking a sip of lukewarm water, I take another sip of the latte and, as expected, the rich espresso, soft coffee, foam, and finally the bitterness I feel... A wonderful coffee flavor.

The coffee shop's ambiance is cozy, modern, and comfortable, with soft lighting and elegant decor. The menu is diverse and extensive, offering a wide range of coffee, tea, pastries, and other beverages. This coffee shop is an excellent choice for those seeking a relaxing atmosphere, delicious coffee, and a wonderful

Nice cafe with friendly staffs, great coffees. They sell some local snacks and candies and instant salt coffee as well.
Bonus: they take apple pay!

places.address: 65 B·∫øn Ngh√©, Ph√∫ H·ªôi, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Located on Pham Ngu Lao Street, DMZ Bar & Restaurant is a popular spot in Hue city. The place is creatively decorated with snake-themed patterns and recycled barrels turned into unique furniture. It's a great spot to enjoy snacks and drinks while soaking in the lively street atmosphere. With a capacity of up to 300 people, this restaurant offers a spacious and elegant setting for visitors to relax and dine.

sources.snippet: The bar is one of the indispensable places for the young at night. There are many types of bars serving the different entertainment needs of guests from budget to luxury; some bars offer guests a lively atmosphere or just to taste a cup of wine or local beer and relax. DMZ Bar is for mild relaxation.
sources.shortName: Hue nightlife for what to do when you visit this romantic city

places.name: DMZ Bar & Restaurant

reviews.text: Stopped at this place the morning we arrived.  Ordered English Breakfast and Banana Pancakes with Orange Sauce.  Both were delicious.  Lots of things to look at. Great mixed menu

It is located in a fantastic area of town for food and life. This bar has a reasonably priced restaurant and bar. It has a large pool table, and the decor is a good vibe. Its a good place to begin, have, or finish your night in. It's definitely a pillar of the area. Kim was a lovely server. The staff were attentive.
Had the best time here! Very yummy food and even better cocktails!! Also the place looks amazing and the staff is very friendly.

places.address: 60 L√™ L·ª£i, Ph√∫ H·ªôi, Hu·∫ø, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Ancient Hue Garden Houses are a must-visit in Hue, offering a glimpse into traditional Vietnamese architecture and culture. These houses have inspired poets and authors with their serene landscapes, including Ngu Binh mountain, Huong river, and Bach Ma mountain. During the summer, visitors can also enjoy the nearby beaches such as Lang Co beach, Thuan An beach, and Canh Duong beach for a refreshing experience.

sources.snippet: In addition, there are a lot of landscapes for visitors to visit in Hue including Ngu Binh mountain, Huong river, Bach Ma mountain and Hue garden house. Most of them have become the inspiration of many poets and authors to compose profound literary works. On Summer, visitors can go to visit beaches as Lang Co beach, Thuan Ann beach and Canh Duong beach to have a refresh feelings.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

places.name: Ancient Hue Garden Houses

reviews.text:
This hotel is the very definition of a jewel (un vrai bijou as we say in French).

Seated in wonderful lush greenery it offers two styles of rooms, Garden Houses and French Villas. As we are a family we chose to book a room in both styles and neither disappointed. Aside from being very clean and having all the necessary amenities, the rooms were spacious, and extremely thoughtfully decorated.

We also had the pleasure of dining at their Vietnamese restaurant. The food was wonderful and copious and allowed us to try a nice variety of Vietnamese dishes.  Special mention for the incredible edible arrangements that decorated the plates!

Last but not least, a big thank you to the kind staff that took care of us during our stay, always efficiently and always with a smile ! We hope to be able to visit again in the future !

We ate dinner here on a Saturday night. It was such an awesome experience. $70 AUD set menu, everything was really delicious. When you get a set menu you can dress up and taste the ‚ÄòKings wine' for free. The dress up made the experience extra special. Staff were so lovely, the setting is beautiful. If you are looking for a fancy meal that is both authentic and fun, highly recommend!!!

If there were 6 stars, I would rate them. This is one of the most, if not the most, amazing hotels I've ever stayed
Service is extremely good and nice. All the staff is great. I would come back to Hue just to stay here. Congratulations to all the staff!

Hopefully this is the review you were looking for to finally book

places.address: 47 Ki·ªát 104 Kim Long, Kim Long, Hue city, Th√†nh ph·ªë Hu·∫ø 49000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Lang Co Beach is a popular tourist destination located in a fishing village. It offers beautiful sandy shores and clean waters, making it an ideal spot for a refreshing getaway. While the beach lacks some facilities and activities, there are excellent restaurants nearby offering fresh seafood. The surrounding tropical scenery and translucent sea create a dream-like atmosphere, perfect for relaxation. Access to the beach is through the road of a resort, but the journey itself is scenic and worth experiencing.

sources.snippet: On Summer, visitors can go to visit beaches as Lang Co beach, Thuan Ann beach and Canh Duong beach to have a refresh feelings.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

places.name: Lang Co Beach

reviews.text: If you love tourist traps this ins't the place for you, this is an authentic Vietnamese beach/fishing village. The south side of the beach was clean, quiet and tranquil. There are touristy food and drink options to the north although there are plenty of local options in the village. Bring a blanket and buy your drinks in one of the local shops in the village.
Cute beach for taking photos but not very clean. Limited options for food and drinks. Da Nang and Hoi An have better beach options, if you have been there already don't bother stopping here.

This is fairly quiet beach when we visited today at 11am. Barely six people were swimming here despite a massive beach. Lots of fresh seafood restaurants line the beach.
Unfortunately there are some uncared for trash that line the beach but if you ignore that, the water is very pleasant to swim in.

places.generalDescription: Hue Night Walking Street is a historical and cultural hub located in the heart of Vietnam, along the Perfume River. It was once the capital city of Vietnam and served as the seat of power for the royal family. The city boasts a rich history, with its Imperial City declared a World Heritage Site. Today, Hue has transformed into a budget-friendly destination with various accommodations, bars, and restaurants in areas like Pham Ngu Lao and Vo Thi Sau street.

sources.snippet: Many of Hue‚Äôs main attractions, such as the Imperial City, Dong Ba Market, and the Perfume River area, are within walking distance from central hotels. Walking is a relaxing way to experience the city‚Äôs charm and discover local cafes and shops along the way. Hue‚Äôs weather can be very hot, especially from April to September, so bring water and consider an early start.
sources.shortName: Discover the Best Things to Do in Hue Top Attractions &Activities

sources.snippet: Hue Night Walking Street, or ‚ÄúHue Western Street,‚Äù went into operation on September 29th, 2017. With the opening of this attraction, Hue becomes much more dynamic and bustling at night. It is a decent place for visitors to see, taste, and enjoy the most interesting things in Hue - the ancient capital of Vietnam.
sources.shortName: Hue Night Walking Street - A vibrant part of the city
Hue nightlife for what to do when you visit this romantic city

places.name: Hue Walking Street

reviews.text:
I was very happy while walking in this street. It has a beautiful vibe and positive energy, especially at night. The street is full of shops and places to eat.

The area is closed so you can walk freely without any cars passing.

Nice walk to here from the Imperial City recently in February on an early evening.

Plenty of restaurants and drinking places around but no night market.
Just sit and chill,catch the world goes by.

A busy walking street!!
Very nice atmosphere, lots of music differences but it was a wonderful experience!! Love it here !!

The price of everything is nice, not expensive at all, very affordable and the people are nice

places.generalDescription: Ch√πa Thi·ªÅn L√¢m, also known as the Lying Buddha or Standing Buddha Pagoda, is a serene Buddhist temple situated on Quang Te Hill in Hue. The pagoda is renowned for its stunning architecture and houses two remarkable statues: a 7-meter-long reclining Buddha and an 8-meter-tall standing Buddha.

sources.snippet: Hue is famous for having a lot of pagodas such as Thien Mu pagoda, Huyen Khong pagoda, Tu Dam pagoda and Thien Lam pagoda. These pagodas are designed with the unique architecture and the combination between old and new art, they bring visitors to the mystical spiritual world.
sources.shortName: A romantic and poetic capital of Thua Thien Hue - Destinations in Vietnam

places.name: Ch√πa Thi·ªÅn L√¢m - Theravada

reviews.text: A peaceful place with awesome architecture
Still building but already impressive and beautiful
Beautiful pagoda in Hue
